Distinct Counting Sketches¶

class _datasketches.hll_sketch¶
static deserialize(bytes: str) → _datasketches.hll_sketch¶

Reads a bytes object and returns the corresponding hll_sketch

get_compact_serialization_bytes(self: _datasketches.hll_sketch) → int¶

Returns the size of the serialized sketch when compressing the exception table if HLL_4

get_estimate(self: _datasketches.hll_sketch) → float¶

Estimate of the distinct count of the input stream

get_lower_bound(self: _datasketches.hll_sketch, num_std_devs: int) → float¶

Returns the approximate lower error bound given the specified number of standard deviations in {1, 2, 3}

static get_max_updatable_serialization_bytes(lg_k: int, tgt_type: _datasketches.tgt_hll_type) → int¶

Provides a likely upper bound on serialization size for the given parameters

static get_rel_err(upper_bound: bool, unioned: bool, lg_k: int, num_std_devs: int) → float¶

Returns the a priori relative error bound for the given parameters

get_updatable_serialization_bytes(self: _datasketches.hll_sketch) → int¶

Returns the size of the serialized sketch

get_upper_bound(self: _datasketches.hll_sketch, num_std_devs: int) → float¶

Returns the approximate upper error bound given the specified number of standard deviations in {1, 2, 3}

is_compact(self: _datasketches.hll_sketch) → bool¶

True if the sketch is compact, otherwise False

is_empty(self: _datasketches.hll_sketch) → bool¶

True if the sketch is empty, otherwise False

property lg_config_k¶

Configured lg_k value for the sketch

reset(self: _datasketches.hll_sketch) → None¶

Resets the sketch to the empty state in coupon collection mode

serialize_compact(self: _datasketches.hll_sketch) → bytes¶

Serializes the sketch into a bytes object, compressing the exception table if HLL_4

serialize_updatable(self: _datasketches.hll_sketch) → bytes¶

Serializes the sketch into a bytes object

property tgt_type¶

Returns the HLL type (4, 6, or 8) when in estimation mode

to_string(self: _datasketches.hll_sketch, summary: bool = True, detail: bool = False, aux_detail: bool = False, all: bool = False) → str¶

Produces a string summary of the sketch

update(*args, **kwargs)¶

Overloaded function.

  1. update(self: _datasketches.hll_sketch, datum: int) -> None

Updates the sketch with the given integral value

  1. update(self: _datasketches.hll_sketch, datum: float) -> None

Updates the sketch with the given floating point value

  1. update(self: _datasketches.hll_sketch, datum: str) -> None

Updates the sketch with the given string value

class _datasketches.theta_sketch¶
get_estimate(self: _datasketches.theta_sketch) → float¶

Estimate of the distinct count of the input stream

get_lower_bound(self: _datasketches.theta_sketch, num_std_devs: int) → float¶

Returns an approximate lower bound on the estimate at standard deviations in {1, 2, 3}

get_num_retained(self: _datasketches.theta_sketch) → int¶

Returns the number of items currently in the sketch

get_seed_hash(self: _datasketches.theta_sketch) → int¶

Returns a hash of the seed used in the sketch

get_theta(self: _datasketches.theta_sketch) → float¶

Returns theta (effective sampling rate) as a fraction from 0 to 1

get_theta64(self: _datasketches.theta_sketch) → int¶

Returns theta as 64-bit value

get_upper_bound(self: _datasketches.theta_sketch, num_std_devs: int) → float¶

Returns an approximate upper bound on the estimate at standard deviations in {1, 2, 3}

is_empty(self: _datasketches.theta_sketch) → bool¶

Returns True if the sketch is empty, otherwise False

is_estimation_mode(self: _datasketches.theta_sketch) → bool¶

Returns True if sketch is in estimation mode, otherwise False

is_ordered(self: _datasketches.theta_sketch) → bool¶

Returns True if the sketch entries are sorted, otherwise False

to_string(self: _datasketches.theta_sketch, print_items: bool = False) → str¶

Produces a string summary of the sketch
